ygData.subject: Re: Re: Exp loss for dying
ygData.msgSnippet: When is it that you are supposed to loose a whole bubble or more of XP?  I try not to die as much as possible, but I have an affinity for dying in the hell
ygData.messageBody:
When is it that you are supposed to loose a whole bubble or more of XP? I
try not to die as much as possible, but I have an affinity for dying in the
hell levels... A LOT. I've never seen more then a 3/4 of a bubble of lost
XP each time and usually it is lot less than that. I was originally told
that whole bubbles are at 31 but I'm beginning to think that is a tale used
to scare children away from the 30's :-). Then again, the concept of
random XP loss certainly seems to make a lot of sense as well.

Taneran Dreamweaver
<Clan Jax>
Bard of the 35th song
Prexus

----- Original Message -----
From: Eric Boller <eboller@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 04, 2000 7:53 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Exp loss for dying


> From: Eric Boller <eboller@...>
>
> I noticed a similar thing this weekend as well. I'm
> 30th level now. However, I died twice in level 29
> while approaching 30. Neither time did I lose more
> than a quarter bubble of health. In level 30 I've
> died twice and I think I've lossed maybe an eighth of
> a bubble each time. Has anyone died lately that isn't
> in a hell level?
>
> Thex Luteslinger
> 30th level bard
